text: We see a clean moving POV illuminated by headlights.  We' floating down an old two-lane highway through a desolate, desert landscape.  This gliding, eerie POV continues as  credits roll. when the credits end, the headlights seem t dim and soon we're moving through BLACKNESS.

in the blackness, a man, FRED, is sitting on a bed smokin cigarette. we see his back, but with each glow of the  cigarette ash, we see his face reflected in a mirror on t wall across from him.  In the darkness, there starts the  sound of a motor which draws curtains back across a large picture window just off screen.  As the curtain moves, ha light begins crawling across the room, and we see  everything clearly.  Fred is wearing a robe and pajamas, early morning. CLOSE UP ON FRED'S FACE IN THE MIRROR - Blank expression face somewhat obscured or distorted by smoke from the  cigarette. CLOSE UP 0N FRED'S ACTUAL FACE - Unshaven, haggard look, seem empty, glazed over.  Fred is 32 years old, with dark hair. THE DOORBELL RINGS.  Fred looks up, startled by the noise He looks at the digital clock: 5:30 a.m. FRED STANDS, goes to an INTERCOM on the wall next to the  mirror.  He pushes a button. A VOICE comes over the intercom.

Dick Laurent is dead. Fred leaves the bedroom and goes through the house.  He i the upstairs level.  He looks through a narrow slot windo but can't see the front door below.  He goes further in t house to a picture window that overlooks the street below There is NOBODY there.
We can see Fred standing at the picture window, looking o

Fred is dressed to go out: Black sport coat and slacks,  buttoned up white shirt.  He picks up a music case.  A wo comes into the room.  This is Fred's wife, RENEE, 30 year old, dark hair, dressed smartly, a drink in her hand.
You don't mind that I'm not coming tonight?
What are you going to do?
I thought I'd stay home and read. Fred looks her over, she's sexy without trying.
Read?... Read what, Renee? Renee sits down on a couch and sips her drink.  Fred come over to her, kisses her on the neck, which makes her laug
It's nice to know I can still make you laugh.
I like to laugh, Fred.
That's why I married you.
Wake me up when you get home. Fred brushes her cheek with his fingers, allowing them to linger for a moment on her face.
A blue neon sign reads: LUNA LOUNGE.

Fred is on the bandstand.  He takes a solo on his saxopho Fred plays hot, hard, neo-bop.  The BAND wails madly behi him.  The PATRONS explode onto the dance floor, making it wild scene.  Fred Is a lion now, roaring away on his teno driving everyone nuts.
After the band quits to take a break, FEMALE FANS come on Fred, but he moves away, refusing their attentions.
Fred dials a pay phone.
INT. The MADISON HOUSE - NIGHT We move through the empty living room - empty bedroom, et The ringing telephone goes unanswered.
LOSE UP 0N FPED'S FACE as he listens to the ringing.   Sweat is still rolling off his face.  His eyes are blank.
Fred's car pulls up in the driveway in front of his house Fred gets out, and goes into the house carrying his music case.
Fred puts down his music case, goes to the bedroom, and s Renee sleeping soundly.

Renee in a bathrobe, opens the front door to collect the  mail.  She sees a plain, clean, manila envelope lying on step.  She picks it up. CLOSE UP ON THE ENVELOPE - No stamp, no writing, blank. takes the mail from the box, and goes back into the house

Renee opens the manila envelope. She's noticeably nervous when she sees a videotape inside.  She stares at it. Fred enters, also wearing a bathrobe.  He sees Renee star at the videotape - before she hears him enter.  When she hear him, her eyes jerk away from the tape.
What's that?
A videotape.
Who's it from?
I don't know... There's no return address  on the envelope... In fact, there's no  address on it.
Does it say anything on the tape?
(looking it over)
No, nothing. Fred walks over and picks up the tape.
Well, let's see what's on it. Fred takes the tape to the VCR.  He inserts it into the machine, and turns it on.  Fred goes toward the couch.
(to Renee)

Come on. They sit on the couch in front of the television. The TV monitor: We begin on the TV, then the videotape fi the entire frame.  The videotape shows the front of THE  MADISON HOUSE, the camera panning slowly over it.  The  picture is accompanied by an eerie DRONING SOUND.  After camera pans back to the front door, the tape image turns Fred and Renee stare at the snow for a few moments.  Rene looks relieved.
It must be from a real estate agent.
Maybe. We see a WIDE SHOT encompassing Fred, Renee, and the snow image on the TV.

Renee is seated at the dining room table - coffee cup and grapefruit in front of her.  She is wearing glasses, read a book.  Fred enters, and sees Renee, who does not look u acknowledge him.  Fred goes into the kitchen, which is ju off the dining room.  He comes back into the dining room a cup of coffee, and sits down with it opposite Renee.  H lights up a cigarette, sips his coffee, and looks at her.
Good book, huh?
(she looks up)
Huh?... oh, yeah, it is.
Same one you were reading the other night?
What night?
When you didn't come to the club.
Oh. Oh, yeah.  No. This is a different one.
I called, you know.
Called?  When?
From the club.  You didn't answer.
I must have fallen asleep.  I was asleep when you got home, wasn't I?
You were asleep when I got home, yes. Renee goes back to her book.  Fred sips his coffee and  smokes.
(without looking up)

I told you you could wake me up if you wanted to. Renee looks up at him now, takes off her glasses, and sta at him. CLOSE UP OF FRED'S FACE - a disturbed expression. Renee seems about to say something more, but stops, puts glasses back on and resumes reading.

Fred is in bed waiting for Renee.  He hears noises from t bathroom - bottles clinking, drawers opening and closing. Renee comes out wearing a robe, which she sheds just befo getting into bed.  Naked under the covers, she switches o her bedside lamp.  The only light in the room comes from outside, through the windows.  Fred moves closer to Renee puts his lips to her cheek, a hand on her breast.  She do not respond.  Fred pulls Renee to him, and kisses her  passionately.  Renee accedes to his demands, but does not participate willingly.  He makes love to her voraciously, her lack of passion disturbs him.  Fred can't stop, howev and when he comes she acts consolingly, stroking him  maternally while he calms down.  He climbs off of her and retreats to his side of the bed. CLOSE UP ON FRED'S EYES - which express his horror and  humiliation. They lie there in the dark silence for a while. Fred turns back toward Renee in the darkness.
I had a dream about you last night...
Yeah?
You were in the house... calling my name... but I couldn't find you.
Fred is walking slowly across the living room. Fred's POV: moving - searching. Fred stops and listens.
(tentatively - distant and off screen)

Fred?  Fred, where are you? The camera turns slowly back toward the hallway, and as i drifts it RISES UP following along the hall and turning  slowly into the bedroom.  Renee is lying below in the bed
Then there you were... lying in bed...  but it wasn't you... It looked like  you... but it wasn't. The camera suddenly dives violently at Renee - into a TIG CLOSE UP.  Her face registers TOTAL FEAR.

Fred is lying in bed with Renee, who is now backlit by he bedside lamp.  Fred looks at her shadowed face, but it's Renee's face.  It's a face Fred has never seen before.  F quickly turns and switches on his bedside lamp, and looks quickly back at Renee, whose face is now her own.
Fred, are you all right? Fred reaches out a hand and tenderly touches her face.  R covers his hand with her own, and closes her eyes.
Renee finds another envelope on the doorstep.  She opens pulls out a videotape.  A large dog is BARKING incessantl somewhere in the neighborhood.  Renee looks around to see she can see the dog.
Renee brings the videotape upstairs with the rest of the  mail.  She is a bit puzzled and unsettled.  She puts the down on a table.  She stares at it.  Fred comes in.
You're up early.
That dog woke me.  I lay there for a while, then decided to get up.
Who the hell owns that dog? Fred notices the tape and manila envelope on the table.
What's that?  Another tape?
Yes, I just found it on the step. Fred picks it up.
Don't you want to watch it?
I guess so. Fred goes to the VCR and inserts the tape.  He turns the  television on.  He is about to start the tape - he looks for Renee.  She's hanging back.
Well, do you wanna watch it? Again, Renee seems to be nervous about what could be on t tape, but she hides this from Fred and walks toward the  couch.

Yeah. Renee sits on the couch.  Fred starts the VCR and joins h As before, we first see it on the TV, then the videotape  fills the frame.  This tape shows the front of the house, before, then shows the INTERIOR of Fred and Renee's house AT NIGHT. The eerie DRONING SOUND goes throughout. The camera glides at a very high angle near the ceilings  looking down as it travels along a hallway and turns into their bedroom, where we see Fred and Renee sleeping.  The tape image then goes to snow. Fred and Renee stare at the snowy TV picture.  After a fe moments of silence, Renee gets up and switches off the se She is visibly shaken, trembling.  She stares fearfully a Fred who seems less disturbed.
We've got to call the police.
All right.
Renee is on the telephone.  Fred is pacing, smoking, behi her.
...yes, I've been on hold for ten minutes... I can't... All right, thanks. Renee looks around anxiously.  Fred gives her his cigaret which she puffs on.  He lights another and continues paci

Hello, yes... Good... My name is Renee Madison... My husband is Fred Madison, the jazz musician... we        live at 442 Hollis Street... Right... 442 Hollis... near the observatory... Someone's been in the house... at night... while we were sleeping... I know because they sent,  dropped off a videotape... two  videotapes... to show us... That's  right... Yes... it... the second one...  shows us asleep... Someone broke in and  taped us while we slept!... Isn't that  enough?... Okay, sure... We will... 442  Hollis... Yes, we'll be here. Renee hangs up.
So?
Two detectives are coming out.

Two men in suits - the Detectives, ED and AL, are seated the couch, watching the last part of the second videotape The screen goes to snow and stays that way for several  moments, until Fred shuts it off.
That's it.
Let's have a look at the hallway outside the bedroom.
All four of them go to the hallway, where Ed and Al look  around, especially up toward the ceiling.
Very strange.
What is?
The angle.  The high angle shot on the tape.
How'd the camera get so high like that?
And smooth... Almost no movement - back and forth, I mean.
Like you'd get if it was hand held.
Right ... This just glided along.
The Detectives enter the bedroom.  Fred and Renee follow.
This is the bedroom. The Detectives look around without touching anything.
Do you always sleep here?... In this room?... Both of you?
This is our bedroom.
There's no other bedroom?
No... There is, I mean, I use it as a practice room... it's soundproofed.
You're a musician?
Yes, I thought my wife ...
What's your axe?
Tenor... Tenor saxophone.  Do you...
(shakes his head)
Tone deaf.
(to Renee)
Do you own a video camera?
No. Fred hates them. The Detectives both look at Fred.
I like to remember things my own way.
What do you mean by that?
How I remember them.  Not necessarily the way they happened.
Do you have an alarm system?
Yes, actually we do... but we haven't been using it.
Why not?
It kept going off for some reason.  False alarms.
Might be a good time to try using it again.
Anybody else have a key to the house.
No.
Maid?  Relative?
No, one of us is always here to let the  maid in.  Nobody else has a key.
(to Al)
Let's check the doors and windows... See if there's been a break-in. They all leave the bedroom.

head_text.subj: INT THE MADISON HOUSE FRONT DOOR

text: Ed is checking the door for marks.
Fred's POV: He's watching Ed and Al with Renee who are  outside the house, walking around the property, checking  it out.
Ed and Al are standing by an unmarked police car with Fre and Renee.  The Detectives are about to depart.
We'll keep a watch on the house.
As best we can.
If anything else happens, you'll call us. Al hands Fred a card.  Ed hands Renee a card.
We will.
Thanks, guys.
It's what we do. Ed and Al get into the car and drive off.  Renee and Fred look at each other, warily, then go back into the house.

Fred is on the bandstand, sweating, and honking his saxophone.  He handles the horn roughly, braying like a b as the CROWD gathered in front of the stage gyrates as on swept away in the madness of the moment.

At the back, near the side door, Renee can be seen with T MEN, only one of whose faces we see.  The trio are going the side door led by one of the men; we see only the back his head.  Renee glances briefly at the bandstand before exits with the two men.
CLOSE UP OF        FRED as he plays, seemingly oblivious surroundings. His eyes open and shut as he clamps down on the horn.
In the back of the club, the side door slowly closes.

Fred is standing in the living room looking in the direct of the stairwell.  We HEAR someone's steps coming up the  stairs.  It's Renee, who eventually comes into view.  She holding another manila envelope.  She arrives at the top  step. She and Fred lock eyes. Fred takes the envelope, opens it, and pulls out a third  videotape. without saying anything, Fred takes the tape t the VCR.  He inserts it very carefully, slowly.  He hits  play, turns on the television and he and Renee sit down o the couch together and begin to watch with great  apprehension. Again we begin with a WIDE SHOT and then the TV monitor f the screen: We see the interior of the house at night.  T camera glides looking down from a high angle along the  hallway and into the bedroom, where Fred and Renee are  sleeping. Again, the DRONING SOUND plays throughout. in the bedroom where Fred and Renee are seen sleeping,  SUDDENLY, Fred, on the tape, slowly awakens as the camera holds on him.  He rises and turns unnaturally in the bed, if drawn up by his awareness of some strange presence in room.  He comes to a sitting position, his head straining upwards, looking in the direction of the camera.  At this point, the videotape image turns to snow.
Fred and Renee are on the couch.  The TV remains on, show snow. Renee is very upset, crying.
What the hell is going on?!
(equally horrified - frightened)
I wish I knew. Fred reaches over and tentatively takes Renee's hand in h She trembles, allows him to touch her, but otherwise does respond.  Suddenly, she jumps with fright.
What was that?!!!
What?
On the tape!  There was something else on the tape. Fred gets up and rewinds it, passing an image.

There!  Play it! Fred runs the tape forward. We see snow - then a half-second long MEDIUM SHOT of Fred his knees near the bedroom wall on Renee's side of the be He is looking directly at the camera - his face a ghastly grimace, contorted.  His eyes are WIDE WITH HORROR. Fred runs it back again and FREEZES the tape there on his tormented image.  This image fills the screen.  He and Re stare at it.
The Detectives, with Fred and Renee are seated on chairs the couch.  The three videotapes in their manila envelope are stacked on a coffee table in the center.
You don't remember being awakened?  It looks like you were aware of someone.
Or something.
No, I don't remember anything. it looks like I... but... I don't remember.
Why would anyone do something like this?
Has anyone made any threats to either of you recently?
Or not so recently?
No, not to me. Al, Ed and Fred all look at Renee.
I...        no. No. No threats.
We'll take the tapes with us, if that's all right with you? Ed looks at Fred, then Renee, both of whom nod their  agreement.
We'll see that the patrol of the house is doubled.
I don't know if I want to stay here.  I don't feel safe.
Where would you feel safe?
I don't know. maybe a hotel. Ed and Al are watching this exchange between Fred and Ren with keen interest. There is a strained silence between them.
Did you use the alarm system since we were here last?
The first night ... Not the last two.
Why not?
(shrugs)
I forgot.  Anyway, I hate the idea of acting paranoid.
Acting paranoid?!!! Someone is in our  house while we're sleeping, filming us,  and you don't want to act paranoid?!!! I  thought you set the alarm! Fred gets up, lights a cigarette, paces.
I'll make sure the alarm is set from now on.
But that doesn't solve the problem.  Who is doing this?  And why? Ed and Al rise from their chairs.  Ed picks up the envelo
We'll find out, Mrs. Madison. Renee stands with the Detectives.  Fred stands apart - hi expression, pained and bewildered.

A swinging party is in progress at Andy's house - the man whose face we saw at the Luna Lounge with Renee.  ANDY, 3 years old, a slick guy, is seen moving through the crowd, making small talk, kissing and being kissed.  The PEOPLE are wannabe players, the men mostly shady, gold-chain- wearing, slightly unsavory types; the women dressed  provocatively, big hair and skin-tight dresses.  Through  sliding glass doors we see nude and semi-nude people  cavorting in a swimming pool.  Everyone has a drink in hi her hand.  Renee finishes her drinkt and hands the empty glass to Fred who walks away with it.  Andy grabs Renee, dances with her.  They laugh and talk.  Renee appears to bit intoxicated. Fred, who appears less than thrilled with the carryings o makes his way to the open bar where he orders two drinks. When the drinks arrive he drains one of them completely, sets the empty glass down on the bar.  Then he swallows t other drink, too, and sets down the glass. A MYSTERY MAN, tall, well-dressed and groomed, older than Fred, approaches him.
We've met before, haven't we?
I don't think so.  Where was it that you think we've met?
At your house.  Don't you remember?
(surprised)
No, no I don't.  Are you sure?
Of course.  In fact, I'm there right now.
(incredulous)
What do you mean?  You're where right now?
At your house.
That's absurd. The Mystery Man reaches into his coat pocket, takes out a cellular phone and holds it out to Fred.
Call me. Fred snickers, like this is a bad joke.  The Mystery Man the phone into Fred's hand.
Dial your number. Fred hesitates, puzzled.
Go ahead. Fred shrugs, laughs, dials his number. We HEAR a pick up we stay on FRED'S FACE.
I told you I was here. Fred, still holding the phone, stares at the man standing front of him.
How did you do that? The Mystery Man points to the phone.
Ask me.
Fred, mirthful at first, as if it is a party trick of som kind, suddenly turns serious - it's obvious he's thinking of the videotapes.  He speaks into the phone.
(angrily)
How did you get into my house?
You invited me.  It's not my habit to go where I'm not wanted. Fred looks at the man in front of him, but speaks again i the phone.
Who are you? The man laughs - identical laughs - both over the phone a
Give me my phone back. The man in front of Fred reaches out his hand for the pho Fred hears the line go dead, and he slowly passes the pho back to the Mystery Man who takes it, folds it, and puts
It's been a pleasure talking to you. The man walks away from Fred.  Renee appears and comes up
I thought you were getting me a drink?
Just a minute. He takes Renee by the arm and goes over to the host of th party, Andy.  He grabs Andy and points across the room to the Mystery Man, who is engaged in conversation with OTHE GUESTS.
Andy, who is that guy?
(looking at the Mystery Man)
I don't know his name.  He's a friend of Dick Laurent's, I think.
Dick Laurent?
Yes, I believe so.
(remembering something)
But Dick Laurent is dead, isn't he?
He is?  I didn't think you knew Dick. How do you know he's dead? Andy and Renee exchange a worried look, which Fred does n
I don't.  I don't know him.
(angrily)
Dick can't be dead.  Who told you he was dead?
Honey, who?... Who's dead? Fred takes Renee by the arm away from Andy.
Let's go home.
But...
Now!  We're leaving now! I didn't want to come here in the first place. Fred drags the reluctant Renee out of Andy's house.
Fred is driving fast and recklessly.  Renee is drunk and smiling at him.
How'd you meet that asshole, Andy, anyway? Renee stares out the front window - thinks back.
It was a long time ago... I met him at  this place called Moke's... We... became  friends... He told me about a job...
What job?
I don't remember... Anyway, Andy's  okay...
He's got some fucked up friends.
Fred and Renee's car pulls up in front of their house.  F jumps out of the car.
Stay in the car! Fred enters the house, careful to turn off the alarm firs

There are only a couple of dim lights on, the house is mo dark.  Fred moves slowly and carefully through his house searching each room for a possible intruder. Fred's POV - moving creepily room by room through the dar house - past the telephone - down the hall to the bedroom There is NO ONE there. He goes back outside for Renee.
Renee is standing next to the car, shivering.
I told you to stay in the car!
Why? what is it?  Why did you make me wait out here?
I thought there might be somebody inside.
Was there?
No... of course not. They enter the house.
Fred switches on more lights.

It's so odd... Waiting out there, I had  the strangest feeling... Like this had  happened before.  I mean, your telling me  to stay outside while you went in like  that. Fred looks at Renee, then continues to look around the ho disturbed, seriously disquieted.  Renee, still tipsy, fol him, moving from room to room.
Fred and Renee are preparing to go to bed. Renee goes the bathroom off the bedroom. Fred takes another look into the hallway.
Fred walks down the hallway.
Fred looks around the dark living room.  Then absentminde he begins to inspect objects.  He picks up an ashtray and studies it - lost in thought.
Renee is washing her face, standing at the sink in her sl
Fred is staring at himself in a mirror.
Renee comes in.  Fred is not there.  She goes to the door peeks down the hallway.
(tentatively)
Fred?  Fred, where are you?
No one is in the living room now - but a SHADOW moves slo across a wall.

Renee's POV - down the hallway.  There is just darkness a the end of the hall.  It is EERIE.  After a moment, Fred  slowly walks out of the darkness toward Renee.  He walks of the shot and the camera remains on the rectangle of  darkness at the end of the hall.

Footsteps can be heard on the stairs.  Fred's head appear the top of the stairway.  He comes up into the living roo carrying a manila envelope, like the ones previously  received.  His expression is strained.  He is alone.  Fre pulls a videotape out of the envelope and inserts it in t VCR, turns it on.  He sits on the couch and watches.  We from a WIDE SHOT to a FULL FRAME SHOT of the video. On the tape is the same nighttime interior of the house,  accompanied by the DRONING SOUND.  The camera moves eeril down the hall toward the bedroom, sliding at a high angle The camera turns slowly into the bedroom - looking down. BLOOD is splattered over the floor, bed, walls.  The came drifts.  THE DEAD BODY OF RENEE lies on the floor at the of the bed.  She is badly mutilated.  Fred is hovering ov her on the tape, ON HIS KNEES, A HORRIFIED, UNBELIEVING  EXPRESSION ON HIS FACE.  On the tape, Fred turns away fro Renee - his hands raised, dripping blood - her blood.  Hi movements are almost mechanical, constricted, as he strai strangely upwards seemingly against his will, as if feeli some enormous pressure.  He looks directly at the camera, face a ghastly grimace, contorted, just before the taped  image goes to snow.
Fred, sitting in front of the TV, shudders as the tape en He sits trembling, attempts to speak, almost chokes, and  finally releases a tortured, warbly cry.
Renee! Fred looks up as if seeing something, he starts to stand, -staggering, partially paralyzed.
(Shouting)
Fred's POV: A BIG FIST slams into Fred's face, knocking h back in a chair.  Ed and Al are standing in front of Fred
Stay put, killer! The Detectives' POV: Fred's face is a bloody mask.  He is crying, whimpering.
I didn't kill her! Tell me I didn't kill her!
Fred, his lips and eyes swollen, sits on a cot, dressed i jail clothes.  He studies his hands, which appear cripple He flexes the fingers, slowly, painfully.

We are in back of the house tracking slowly past the bedr and living room windows. Inside the house, INVESTIGATORS FORENSIC EXPERTS are moving around, measuring, scraping  samples of carpet, searching for fingerprints on furnitur

Renee's CORPSE on a slab is rolled into an examining room an ATTENDANT.  The entrance of the body is shown reflecte a chrome-framed mirror that juts out from a tile wall.  T Attendant prepares for the impending autopsy, laying out rack of instruments, positioning the corpse.  As he is do these things, the MEDICAL EXAMINER enters, accompanied by GIRLFRIEND.  The M.E. is dressed formally, in a tuxedo. young woman is wearing a slinky dress with a fur wrap,  pearls, spike heels.  The couple are close; she has an ar through his, and she laughs, nervously.  He is smoking a  cigarette.
Hi, doc. Workin' late tonight, huh?
Party at the mayor's house, George.  This is his daughter, Joyce.
Howdy, Joyce.
Howdy, George. The Attendant uncovers the body - individual parts are  wrapped like packages from a butcher's shop, and labeled: ARM, HEAD, R. BREST (misspelled).
(looking at the packages)
Just like Christmas. He begins to unwrap them.

I don't know if I can watch this. The M.E. tosses his cigarette down on the floor.  The cam goes down on the smoking cigarette butt on the floor drai smoldering there among hair and flesh gristle on the drai filter screen.
(Voice-over)

Leave any time you want, lover.  I won't take it personally. The camera stays on the drain as we HEAR the M.E. unwrapp the packaged body parts.  Joyce's high heels enter the fr around the drain.  She is stepping nervously, like a spoo horse.  The clatter of her heels is very loud.  We hear t M.E. chuckle.
(Voice-over)
Easy, girl, easy.
You talking to me or... her?
(laughs)
A corpse can tell you plenty, Joyce.

The camera is behind a female FOREMAN in the jury box.  T shot begins on her shoes and travels up her body as she stands.  Over her left shoulder we see Fred standing at t defense table. Over her right shoulder the JUDGE is seate
Have you reached a verdict?
Yes, we have, your honor.

Please hand it to the bailiff. The BAILIFF goes to the Foreman, takes the paper from her then takes it to the Judge.  The Judge opens it and reads to himself, then hands it back to the Bailiff, who return to the Foreman.
And what is your verdict? The camera moves to Fred, registering his tension.  The  camera goes to the Foreman's face.
We the jury find the defendant guilty of murder in the first degree. Fred faints.  Fe is lifted up by his ATTORNEY and GUARDS attendance.  Fred revives slightly.

Fred Madison, the jury having found you  guilty of murder in the first degree, it  is my order that on a date to be  determined, you be put to death in the  electric chair. We see Fred's eyes roll open as he cranes his neck around upwards, looking at the video camera high on the wall of courtroom, pointing down on him.
MARIAN and RAQUEL, two exquisite young women, are looking over the merchandise.
Did you see that about the guy who  chopped up his wife into a million  pieces?
How could I miss it?  The TV won't quit with that stuff.
They're gonna cook him.
Andy's from Utah.  He says there you have  a choice... You can die by hanging or by  firing squad.
Which would you choose? Marian holds up a black teddy to her body.
Andy would go for this, don't you  think?... Firing squad, definitely.
Do they aim for the head or for the heart?
The heart, I guess.

I wouldn't... The brain would know what's  going on.  Your heart would be ripped  open trying to pump blood, blood pouring  into the chest cavity.  Savage pain,  Marian. Raquel takes a red teddy and holds it up to her chest.
Oh, that's hot... So you'd rather be hung, huh? They both giggle at the obvious joke.
Absolutely... Soon as your neck snaps,  you black out.  It might take a while for  the body to die, but you wouldn't feel  it. Marian reaches for a pair of panties with a hole in the c

You might be right, Raquel. Marian sticks a finger through the hole in the panties an wiggles it.  The girls giggle.  Raquel sees Andy walking the store.  He is sneaking up behind Marian, and motions a finger to his lips to Raquel not to say anything.  When Andy gets directly behind Marian, he puts his hands over eyes.
Guess who?
